thread.title: NLDS gives Cubs, Cardinals chance to make new memories
thread.title_full: NLDS gives Cubs, Cardinals chance to make new memories

author: R.B. FALLSTROM
title: NLDS gives Cubs, Cardinals chance to make new memories
text:
Darron Cummings NLDS gives Cubs, Cardinals chance to make new memories 
Chicago Cubs manager Joe Maddon responds to a question during a news conference Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in St. Louis. The Cubs are to face the St. Louis Cardinals in Game 1 of the National League Division Series on Friday. (AP Photo/Darron Cummings) Tom Gannam A look at each potential World Series matchup 
St. Louis Cardinals manager Mike Matheny answers questions during a press conference, Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in St. Louis. The Cardinals will face the Chicago Cubs, for the first time in post-season history, in the National League Division Series. (AP Photo/Tom Gannam) Posted: Friday, October 9, 2015 3:26 am NLDS gives Cubs, Cardinals chance to make new memories Associated Press | 0 comments 
ST. LOUIS (AP) — Joe Maddon stepped to the podium spouting names of obscure Cardinals from the past. 
The Cubs manager is also a big fan of the game, and in particular an admirer of St. Louis' stature as one of major league baseball's jewel franchises with 11 World Series titles. Every time he comes to town, he finds a way to work Branch Rickey into the conversation, and the eve of the NL Division Series was no exception. kAm|255@?
